settings.title: linen
settings.feature_text_1:
Linen is a sustainable, natural fiber made from the flax plant. It needs only sun and rain to grow. We grow our flax in Normandy, France, overlooking the English Channel.

Our Bo Shorts, Cham Pants, Playa Shirts, Kite Jackets and Sun Tees are all made with 100% linen.
settings.feature_text_2:
Organic softeners are natural enzymes added to water that break down tough fibers in the wash.

We wash all our clothes with organic softeners to make them super soft from first wear.
settings.feature_text_3:
Natural rubber is harvested from the rubber tree by “tapping” the bark (much like maple syrup). Natural rubber is significantly stronger and more elastic than synthetic rubber.

We use 100% natural rubber for the elastic waistband on all our Bo Shorts.
settings.feature_text_4: Our cut-and-sew factory in India is located in Chennai, a tropical seaside city on the Bay of Bengal. The shop is nearly 50 years old and is known for superior quality (ISO 9001) and excellent working conditions (SA 800).

settings.title: linen
settings.feature_text_1:
Linen is a sustainable, natural fiber made from the flax plant. It needs only sun and rain to grow. We grow our flax in Normandy, France, overlooking the English Channel.

Our Bo Shorts, Cham Pants, Playa Shirts, Kite Jackets and Sun Tees are all made with 100% linen.
settings.feature_text_2:
Organic softeners are natural enzymes added to water that break down tough fibers in the wash.

We wash all our clothes with organic softeners to make them super soft from first wear.
settings.feature_text_3:
Corozo is made from the seeds of the Ivory Palm, a tropical tree native to South America. It looks and feels like horn, giving it the nickname “plant ivory.”

All our buttons are made with 100% corozo.
settings.feature_text_4: Our cut-and-sew factory in India is located in Chennai, a tropical seaside city on the Bay of Bengal. The shop is nearly 50 years old and is known for superior quality (ISO 9001) and excellent working conditions (SA 800).

settings.title: linen
settings.feature_text_1:
Linen is a sustainable, natural fiber made from the flax plant. It needs only sun and rain to grow. We grow our flax in Normandy, France, overlooking the English Channel.

Our Bo Shorts, Cham Pants, Playa Shirts, Kite Jackets and Sun Tees are all made with 100% linen.
settings.feature_text_2:
Organic softeners are natural enzymes added to water that break down tough fibers in the wash.

We wash all our clothes with organic softeners to make them super soft from first wear.
settings.feature_text_3: Our Sun Tees are made in Guimarães, Portugal, a UNESCO heritage site with a linen industry more than 200 years old. The town sits at a confluence of rivers, not far from the ocean, the perfect spot for linen production.

settings.title: leather
settings.feature_text_1:
Raw leather is made from animal hides processed without chemicals. Our leather comes from cows in León, Mexico, a region known for first rate hide production.

We make all our Primo Sandals and Primo Belts with 100% raw leather.
settings.feature_text_2: Our leather products are made in Oaxaca, Mexico by a third generation family business. The shop is located just over the mountains from the Pacific Ocean. Through our collaboration, the business has upgraded machinery and expanded capacity.

settings.title: wool
settings.feature_text_1:
Merino wool is a renewable fiber made from super-soft sheep's wool. We get our merino wool from highland sheep in Australia.

Our Campo Sweaters and Campo Caps are made with 100% merino wool.
settings.feature_text_2: Our knitting facility is located in St. Louis, Missouri right near the Mississippi River. The factory uses cutting edge 3D knitting technology to "print" out knitwear

settings.title: org cotton
settings.feature_text_1:
Organic cotton is grown without fertilizers or pesticides and uses 70% less water than conventional cotton. We grow our organic cotton in northern India in the state of Punjab. 

Our canvas Kite Jackets and Cham Pants are made with 100% organic cotton.
settings.feature_text_2:
Organic softeners are natural enzymes added to water that break down tough fibers in the wash.

We wash all our clothes with organic softeners to make them super soft from first wear.
settings.feature_text_3:
Corozo is made from the seeds of the Ivory Palm, a tropical tree native to South America. It looks and feels like horn, giving it the nickname “plant ivory.”

All our buttons are made with 100% corozo.
settings.feature_text_4: Our cut-and-sew factory in India is located in Chennai, a tropical seaside city on the Bay of Bengal. The shop is nearly 50 years old and is known for superior quality (ISO 9001) and excellent working conditions (SA 800).

settings.title: Esquire

This might come as a surprise: most clothes (65%) are made from plastic. Look at the tags in your closet. If they saypolyesterornylonoracrylic that means plastic.

Our clothes, on the other hand, are made from 100% natural, renewable materials. And that makes us pretty rare: currently, only 1% of clothes are made from natural materials.

settings.quote: If you are looking to shop at more sustainable brands, Alex Crane is the perfect option.

settings.title: Forbes

settings.quote: Alex Crane Is Bringing Non-Tox Textiles To Menswear
settings.title: The Fullest
European Linen
settings.description: Linen is a sustainable, natural fiber made from the flax plant. It needs only sun and rain to grow. We grow our flax in Normandy, France, overlooking the English Channel.
settings.why: Linen is breathable, antimicrobial, heat-regulating, and long-lasting. Normandy is the perfect climate for growing flax and produces some of the highest quality linen on Earth.
settings.featuredin: Our Bo Shorts, Cham Pants, Playa Shirts, Ola Shirts, Kite Jackets and Sun Tees are all made with 100% linen.

settings.title: Organic Cotton
settings.description: Organic cotton is grown without fertilizers or pesticides and uses 70% less water than conventional cotton. We grow our organic cotton in northern India in the state of Punjab.
settings.why: Cotton is naturally soft, durable, and breathable. Only 1% of global cotton production is organic—we want to help increase that percentage.
settings.featuredin: Our Canvas Cham Pants, Canvas Kite Jackets, Quilted Kite Jackets and Porto Shirt are made with 100% organic cotton.

settings.title: Merino Wool
settings.description: Merino wool is a natural fiber made from the wool of Merino sheep. Our Merino wool comes from family-run farms in Australia.
settings.why: Merino wool is uniquely soft. It’s heat-regulating, wicks away moisture and doesn’t hold odor. Plus, it’s naturally renewable (wool grows back).
settings.featuredin: Our Campo Sweaters, Park Shirt Jackets, and Point Jackets are made with 100% Merino Wool

settings.title: Natural Dyes
settings.description: Natural dyes are pigments made from plants and minerals. We use natural dyes derived from rocks and soil.
settings.why: Natural dyes are biodegradable, non-toxic and non-allergenic. Synthetic dyes are made from chemicals and are often mixed with plastic-based liquids.
settings.featuredin: Our Porto shirts are all made with biodegradable natural dyes.

settings.title: Raw Leather
settings.description: All of our leather goods are made with ethically sourced leather.
settings.why: Raw leather is more durable and beathable than chemically treated leather. And it develops a beautiful patina with wear. Only 10% of global leather production is tanned with organic tannins.
settings.featuredin: All our belts and sandals are made with hand-painted leather from León, Mexico.

settings.title: Cactus
settings.description: Cactus leather is a cutting-edge alternative to traditional animal hide. Made in Mexico, the nopal cactus produces a supple, elevated, and renewable quality that is nearly identical to cow leather (arguably even better).
settings.why: Cactus can be harvested for years, requires no irrigation, and has a net positive impact on CO2 emissions.

settings.title: Natural Rubber
settings.description: Natural rubber is harvested from the rubber tree by “tapping” the bark (much like maple syrup). Natural rubber is significantly stronger and more elastic than synthetic rubber.
settings.why: Natural rubber is significantly stronger and more durable than synthetic rubber. Plus, natural rubber is made from organic, renewable resources (rather than plastic).
settings.featuredin: We use 100% natural rubber for the elastic waistband on all our Bo Shorts.

settings.title: Corozo
settings.description: Corozo is made from the seeds of the Ivory Palm, a tropical tree native to South America. It looks and feels like horn, giving it the nickname “plant ivory.”
settings.why: Corozo buttons are extremely strong and heat resistant. Unlike synthetic buttons (made of plastic), corozo buttons are bio- degradable and naturally renewable.
settings.featuredin: The buttons on our Playa Shirts, Ola Shirts, Cham Pants, Kite Jackets, Porto Shirts and Park Shirt Jackets are made with 100% corozo.

settings.title: Coconut
settings.description: Coconut is the fruit of the coconut tree, a palm synonymous with the tropics. The coconut's husk is both tough and lightweight, an ideal material for buttons.
settings.why: Husks are normally discarded, so coconut buttons give new life to a by-product of the food industry. And, unlike plastic buttons, coconut buttons are made from a naturally renewable material.

settings.title: Botanical Dyes
settings.description: Natural pigments derived from flowers, plants, seeds and minerals. Our dyes are made from indigo, weld flowers, avocado and iron ore.
settings.why: Unlike synthetic dyes (which leak toxins), botanical dyes are natural and 100% biodegradable.

settings.title: Organic Softeners
settings.description: Organic softeners are natural enzymes added to water that break down tough fibers in the wash.
settings.why: Most softeners are made from plastic-based synthetics. Natural softeners make our products soft without compromising their ability to biodegrade.
settings.featuredin: All our Playa Shirts, Ola Shirts, Cham Pants, Kite Jackets, Porto Shirts and Park Shirt Jackets are washed with biodegradable enzymes so the fabric is soft from first wear.

settings.title: Made in Chennai
settings.description: Our cut-and-sew factory in India is located in Chennai, a tropical seaside city on the Bay of Bengal. The shop is nearly 50 years old and is known for superior quality (ISO 9001) and excellent working conditions (SA 800).

settings.title: Made in Guimarães
settings.description: Made in Guimarães, Portugal, a UNESCO heritage site with a linen industry more than 200 years old. The town sits at a confluence of rivers, not far from the ocean, the perfect spot for linen production.

settings.title: Made in Connecticut
settings.description: Woven in Connecticut. Cut and sewn in New York City

settings.title: Made in St. Louis
settings.description: Made in St. Louis, Missouri at our partner factory that uses 3D printing technology to knit full garments.

settings.title: Made in Oaxaca
settings.description: Our leather products are made in Oaxaca, Mexico by a third generation family business. The shop is located just over the mountains from the Pacific Ocean. Through our collaboration, the business has upgraded machinery and expanded capacity.

settings.title: Dyed in Pennsylvania
settings.description: Each piece is hand-dyed at a natural dye house in Pennsylvania. We use only naturally occurring, 100% biodegradable pigments.

settings.title: Alpaca
settings.description: Alpaca is a supremely soft natural fiber made from the wool of Alpaca (a close relative of the llama). Alpaca are indigenous to the Andes and have been domesticated for thousands of years.
settings.why: Alpaca fiber is extremely warm, super soft (not a hint of a scratch), moisture-wicking and hypoallergenic. It's also naturally renewable (the wool grows back every year). We use Royal Baby Alpaca, the softest fiber in the alpaca fam.

settings.title: Crafted in the U.S.A
settings.description: We partner with a family-run leather shop in Miami. Each wallet is hand-cut, sewn and stamped.

settings.title: Natural Materials Make Better Clothes
settings.description: Natural materials make better clothes. Unlike plastic, natural materials have evolved over thousands (or millions) of years and are very dynamic. Fibers made from plants and wool are more breathable, more antimicrobial, and more enduring.

settings.title: Natural Materials Biodegrade
settings.description: Natural materials are inherently biodegradable. They come from the Earth, and return just as easily. Clothes made from natural fibers will turn to soil within a year (so long as they’re free of chemical softeners or dyes).

settings.title: Natural Materials Are Renewable
settings.description: Unlike synthetics, natural materials have the capacity to regenerate. Seeds make new plants...which make new seeds. Wool grows back. All that’s required is sun and water (and food for the sheep).

settings.title: Most Clothes Are Made From Plastic
settings.description: 65% of clothes are made from plastic-based fibers. If your tag says polyester, nylon or acrylic...that means plastic. And that’s a problem for three reasons: 1) it keeps us dependent on fossil fuels (plastic is made from petroleum), 2) plastic doesn’t biodegrade and 3) plastic is toxic.

settings.title: Plastic Doesn’t Biodegrade
settings.description: Plastic is a synthetic material. It takes up to 500 years to break down and never actually biodegrades. In other words: all the plastic that has ever existed, still exists. Every plastic bottle, every polyester t-shirt, is still in a landfill or floating in the ocean.

settings.title: Plastic Is Toxic
settings.description: During every wash, plastic-based fibers shed microplastics and leach toxins into the water (plastic is mixed with toxic chemicals). As a result, microplastics are everywhere. New studies show we eat a credit card’s worth of plastic every week.

settings.title:
This might come as a surprise: most clothes (65%) are made from plastic. Look at the tags in your closet. If they say polyester or nylon or acrylic that means plastic.

Our clothes, on the other hand, are made from 100% natural, renewable materials. And that makes us pretty rare: currently, only 1% of clothes are made from natural materials.

Learn more about our process.
Ordered the campo sweater just before Christmas. Love the fit + quality and the staff at Alex Crane were very accommodating to help with my questions.
Love this sweater, perfect balance between style and function. And it's machine washable!
This is my absolute favorite article of clothing. It's warmer than you'd expect…I've been able to wear it in weather from 35º to 75º F. This jacket should last the better part of forever.
Hell of a jacket. Great for spring, summer, and fall. Very happy with my purchase.
This jacket is the most comfortable jacket I’ve ever owned. The inside wool is extremely soft and the outside material is luxe. The classically rugged style is just perfect.
The perfect shacket for chilly weather where you still want to come off stylish. Adding this over a T shirt can easily elevate your outfit.
Very warm and feels great. Perfect fit as well!
A summer essential! Great knockaround shorts. The linen is made for summer. Versatile look to go with more streetwear (sneaks and tees) or a smarter look (loafers and polo/button up).
Couldn’t have asked for anything better. They are so lightweight; wore them to a kids party in a backyard on a hot day and stayed cool and dry. They fit really well- slim without being snug.
These pants will make you look like Brad Pitt in A River Runs Through It.Seriously though, these pants are minimalist and classy as f
Nice fit, great silhouette, pairs really nicely with both a jacket or a sweater. Thick fabric without being bulky. Easy to dress up or down.

Honestly, I LOVE these pants. I have been searching for a pair of linen pants that are a little more robust and less flow-y than the usual ones you find, which are a often wide legged and have side pockets rather than jean-style pockets. These are perfect.
Excellent casual pants. I love the reversed direction of the rear pockets on the Lines pattern. The linen fabric makes them feel like an old best friend. Strait legs a plus, true to size.
This is great clothing: well cut, sturdy, holds up really well after multiple washing, great fabrics and beautiful colours.
This is the most breathable shirt you can own. Bike to work in it on hot days, it has a casual loose fit which makes it even more breathable.
Best linen shirts around! Phenomenal quality, and great with, or without an undershirt.

Excellent fit; very high quality construction; super comfortable and coordinates with everything.
Love it!
The shirt I have been waiting for has arrived. Just great, thanks
From the linen jackets cotton jackets to the quilted version the comfortable Kite jacket will takes you through through the seasons
Beautiful as usual. Liking the slightly oversized look and feel

This jacket is awesome! It’s well made and looks amazing. Great company and outstanding service! I had to exchange for a different size and it was a super easy process. On that note, my suggestion is to order a size up if you like a little room.
Right in between a shirt and jacket. Very comfortable and well made!
Lovely craftsmanship! They’re both rugged and refined. Fit true to size and easy to add a hole if need be.
Literally live in these. The quality is incredible. The patina is wonderful. And I can't stop wearing them. You can't go wrong with these.
